layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My practical knowledge of what foods work for my body is ...
questions.principle: Nutritional knowledge is personalized through testing

answers.4: good — I know what fuels me well and what doesn't
answers.5: dialed in — I've experimented and know exactly what my body needs
answers.2: basic — I know some foods are bad but not what works best
answers.3: developing — I've figured out some things through trial and error
answers.1: absent — I eat whatever and don't notice effects

questions.text: My skill in optimizing my sleep is ...

answers.4: good — I understand my sleep needs and have practices that work
answers.5: optimized — I've dialed in sleep quality through tested methods
answers.2: basic — I know sleep matters but don't know how to improve it
answers.3: developing — I've improved some aspects, still working on others
answers.1: absent — I just sleep when I can

questions.text: My practical cooking and meal prep skills are ...
questions.principle: Food preparation is a practical skill

answers.4: good — I can prepare healthy meals efficiently
answers.5: strong — I have systems that make healthy eating easy
answers.2: basic — I can make a few things but not efficiently
answers.3: developing — I can prepare some healthy meals
answers.1: nonexistent — I can't cook, so I can't eat well

questions.text: My skill in creating environments that support my work and rest is ...

answers.4: good — I know how to set up spaces that support me
answers.5: refined — I've learned exactly what environment I need and create it
answers.2: basic — I know environment matters but don't know how to optimize
answers.3: developing — I've improved some spaces, others need work
answers.1: absent — I work wherever and it shows

questions.text: My ability to troubleshoot when my energy or recovery is off is ...

answers.4: good — I can usually figure out what's off and fix it
answers.5: sharp — I read my body's signals accurately and know how to respond
answers.2: basic — I can sometimes guess what's wrong
answers.3: developing — I can diagnose some issues, not others
answers.1: absent — when I feel bad I don't know why

remediation.advice: Knowing THAT you should eat well and sleep well is not the same as knowing HOW. Learn to cook. Experiment with your sleep environment. Track what foods affect you how. Develop practical, personalized knowledge about YOUR body — not just generic health advice.

scripture.text: So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
